# Pavel Guliaev - System Operator & Growth Architect

## Core Identity
**Role**: System Operator & Growth Architect for Product-Centered Companies.
**One-Liner**: I rebuild broken revenue architecture in product-centric companies and design the first repeatable system of demand → transaction → recurring value.
**Essence**: Pavel is not a marketer; he reconstructs the business system around the transaction. He builds the "Data Route" and "Monetary Cycle".

- **Industry**: FMCG, Consumer Packaged Goods, Beauty & Personal Care, Home Care, Premium Fragrances, Food Retail, D2C Commerce, Elderly Safety (MedTech).
- **Solved Problems**: SKU portfolio bloat, Low sell-through cycles, Misaligned price elasticity, Retail panic signals, Preference leakage, Fragmented product data.

- **Evidence**: Sell-through benchmark achievement, Marketplace analytics, Brand ranking elevation, Revenue share leadership.

## Portfolio & Case History
### 1. BeWell Medical (MedTech / Hardware + SaaS)
- **Role**: Senior Manager of Marketing Strategy.
- **Scenario**: "No Route to Revenue".
- **Action**: Connected R&D data to CRM (Memory Layer), built B2B Partner Portal.
- **Result**: +30% Sales, +40% ROI, Top 3 Organic Search.

### 2. Procter & Gamble via Alidi (FMCG / Home Care)
- **Problem**: Large SKU portfolio with low conversion (0.03%) and slow sell-through.
- **Intervention**: ABC/XYZ mapping, SKU rationalization, Funnel-based ad optimization.
- **Outcome**: +40% Portfolio Uplift, Conversion increased to ~1.2%, Sell-through optimized to 21 days.

### 3. Mondelez via Alidi (FMCG / Food)
- **Problem**: Chaos of versioning and slow data updates (3-6 month latency).
- **Intervention**: Implemented PIM (Product Information Management) and governance model.
- **Outcome**: Real-time sync, erroneous listings reduced, mass upload readiness.

### 4. Vivienne Sabó (Beauty / Crisis)
- **Scenario**: "Wartime retail collapse". Demand polarization.
- **Intervention**: Repositioned versus price-layer territories (not brands). Created repeatable promo mechanics without deep discounting.
- **Outcome**: #1 on Marketplaces, Share growth 16% -> 21%.

### 5. Borges (Food / Retail)
- **Problem**: Low brand recognition vs premium competitors.
- **Intervention**: Vertical livestreams, Chef-driven content, Dynamic time-window discounts.
- **Outcome**: Viewer growth 150 -> 3500, Fast liquidation of stagnant SKUs.

### 6. PUIG (Fragrances)
- **Problem**: No digital articulation of scent experience.
- **Intervention**: Non-literal content framework, Loyalty-loop deconstruction.
- **Outcome**: Shift in digital shelf performance, Better positioning vs incumbents.
